thread.title: Man shot in leg in Rainier Valley, police search for suspect
thread.title_full: Man shot in leg in Rainier Valley, police search for suspect | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Man shot in leg in Rainier Valley, police search for suspect
text:
Officers responded to reports of a shooting in Rainier Valley at around 2:30 p.m.
A 24-year-old man was found with a gunshot wound to his leg, sitting on a sidewalk.
The shooting was reported near South Elmgrove Street and Rainier Avenue South.
Dunlap and Rainier Beach High School sheltered in place, according to the school district -- as police investigated the nearby shooting.
By 3:00 p.m., the schools had lifted their "shelter-in-place" order.
Shelter-in-place: Dunlap, @RainierBeachHS . South Shore dismissed at regular time as did South Lake. @seattlepd investigating nearby shooting
— Seattle Schools (@seapubschools) October 8, 2015 The SB lanes of Rainier Avenue South and South Rose Street were blocked to traffic.
Police searched, with the help of a K-9, but they were unable to find any evidence or a suspect.
ATF brought in a dog to help find evidence at shooting off Rainier Ave S/S Rose after man shot in leg. @KIRO7Seattle pic.twitter.com/mDKoFC7Tr5
— Alison Grande (@AlisonKIRO7) October 8, 2015 This story will be updated as information comes in.
